speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Now old desire doth in his death-bed lie,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And young affection gapes to be his heir;

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: That fair for which love groan'd for and would die,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: With tender Juliet match'd, is now not fair.

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Now Romeo is beloved and loves again,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Alike betwitched by the charm of looks,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: But to his foe supposed he must complain,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And she steal love's sweet bait from fearful hooks:

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Being held a foe, he may not have access

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: To breathe such vows as lovers use to swear;

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And she as much in love, her means much less

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: To meet her new-beloved any where:

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: But passion lends them power, time means, to meet
